comments:
Build id: 200401210900

I had started with a clean workspace, imported all binary plugins required by
o.e.jdt.ui and entered 'dev.eclipse.org' with 'anonymous' as login name in the
CVS repos view.

Then I browsed to the HEAD o.e.jdt.ui directory on the server, right-clicked it
and hit 'Check out'. Instantly, an error-message popped up:

  An internal error occurred during: "Checking out 
  'org.eclipse.jdt.ui' from CVS".

and I had this entry in my log:

!SESSION Jan 22, 2004 10:21:18.915 ---------------------------------------------

java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Jan 22, 2004 10:21:18.915
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Checking out 'org.eclipse.jdt.ui'
from CVS".
!STACK 0

I tried for a second time and the checkout proceeded as usual.
Look slike the NPE is coming from Core.

This exception could only occur when reading from the cache. An I/O exception or
corrupted file may cause a null value be returned instead of an empty array. We
should log the exception in that case (see comment
RegistryCacheReader#loadConfigurationElements) and ensure an empty array is
returned instead of null.

Old summary: "NullPointerException on CVS checkout"

I released a partial fix to ensure null is never returned. Second part of the
problem is to log any exceptions properly while reading from the cache.

It is also important to understand how does the file becomes corrupted.
Would you have any scenario?
The most common scenario where this can happen is described in bug 49112 comment 21.
